alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 3:45PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COLD WIND CHILLS EXPECTED FOR BRISTOL BAY AND THE LOWER KUSKOKWIM VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY... A strong blast of cold, Arctic air will bring sensible temperatures 10 to 20 degrees below zero across Southwest Alaska beginning Saturday afternoon. A strong pressure gradient is expected to set up as the result of the combination of a strong surface high pressure developing in the Bering Sea and a deep low lingering in the Gulf of Alaska. This will drive strong northerly winds through the Lower Kuskokwim Valley and Bristol Bay east of Dillingham, which is likely to result in wind chills dropping to near 40 to 45 degrees below zero for much of the area. With strong winds and cold advection persisting through Monday, cold wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero may persist in some locations through the daytime on Sunday and Monday. Overnight wind chills as low as 45 degrees below zero will continue to be more widespread until winds relax Monday night.
